alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 5:59PM PDT until further notice by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Southwest portion of San Luis Obispo County. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of roadways, creeks, and streams will continue this evening. In addition, there is an ongoing significant risk of mud and rockslides, especially on canyon roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to locally heavy rain. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Rain is expected to end by around midnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Grover Beach, Avila Beach, Oceano, Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade, and Cayucos. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
